# Introduction

This document explores the classification of Antarctic penguins based on morphological characteristics using logistic regression and random forest models. The dataset used is the Palmer Penguins dataset.

The code is taken from the video of [Julia Silge](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z57i2GVcdww&pp=ugMICgJlcxABGAHKBRtwYWxtZXIgcGVuZ3VpbnMgSnVsaWEgU2lsZ2U%3D)

# Load Packages

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(palmerpenguins)
library(tidymodels)
library(kableExtra)
```

# Prepare Data

```{r}
penguins_df <- penguins %>%
  filter(!is.na(sex)) %>%
  select(-island)

set.seed(123)
penguin_split <- initial_split(penguins_df, strata = sex)
penguin_train <- training(penguin_split)
penguin_test <- testing(penguin_split)

set.seed(123)
penguin_boot <- bootstraps(penguin_train)
penguin_boot
```

# Model Specifications

## Logistic Regression

```{r}
glm_spec <- logistic_reg() %>%
  set_engine("glm")
glm_spec
```

## Random Forest

```{r}
rf_spec <- rand_forest() %>%
  set_mode("classification") %>%
  set_engine("ranger")
rf_spec
```

# Workflow

```{r}
penguin_wf <- workflow() %>%
  add_formula(sex ~ .)
penguin_wf
```

# Fit Models

## Logistic Regression

```{r}
glm_rs <- penguin_wf %>%
  add_model(glm_spec) %>%
  fit_resamples(
    resamples = penguin_boot,
    control = control_resamples(save_pred = TRUE)
  )
glm_rs
```

## Random Forest

```{r}
rf_rs <- penguin_wf %>%
  add_model(rf_spec) %>%
  fit_resamples(
    resamples = penguin_boot,
    control = control_resamples(save_pred = TRUE)
  )
rf_rs
```

# Evaluate Models

```{r}
collect_metrics(rf_rs)
collect_metrics(glm_rs)

glm_rs %>%
  conf_mat_resampled()

glm_rs %>%
  collect_predictions() %>%
  group_by(id) %>%
  roc_curve(sex, .pred_female) %>%
  ggplot(aes(1 - specificity, sensitivity, color = id)) +
  geom_abline(lty = 2, color = "gray80", size = 1.5) +
  geom_path(show.legend = FALSE, alpha = 0.6, size = 1.2) +
  coord_equal()
```

# Final Fit and Interpretation

```{r}
penguin_final <- penguin_wf %>%
  add_model(glm_spec) %>%
  last_fit(penguin_split)

collect_metrics(penguin_final)

collect_predictions(penguin_final) %>%
  conf_mat(sex, .pred_class)


```

```{r}
#| label: tbl-res

penguin_final$.workflow[[1]] %>%
  tidy(exponentiate = TRUE) %>%
  kbl(
    caption = "Logistic Regression Classigication Model Coefficients",
    digits = 3,
    col.names = str_to_title(names(.))) %>%
  kable_styling(
    full_width = FALSE,
    bootstrap_options = c("striped", "hover"),
    font_size = 14
  )
```
